description: From Yiddish חדר‎ (kheyder), from Hebrew חדר‎ (khéder, “room”).

nouns.description: cheder (plural cheders or chederim or chedarim or chadarim or chadorim)

entries.meaning: An elementary school for Jewish children, teaching basic Judaism and Hebrew.
examples: A businessman in New York who happened to be in the Midlands at the time was so impressed by Asher's methods that he was funding him to set up a string of chederim – Sunday schools for Jews – all over the United States.
